fields.value: Replication data for: By Force of Habit: A Consumption-Based Explanation of Aggregate Stock Market Behavior

dsDescriptionValue.value: We present a consumption-based model that explains a wide variety of dynamic asset pricing phenomena, including the procyclical variation of stock prices, the long-horizon predictability of excess stock returns, and the countercyclical variation of stock market volatility. The model captures much of the history of stock prices from consumption data. It explains the short-and long-run equity premium puzzles despite a low and constant risk-free rate. The results are essentially the same whether we model stocks as a claim to volatile dividends poorly correlated with consumption. The model is driven by an independently and identically distributed consumption growth process and adds a slow- moving external habit to the standard power utility function. These features generate slow countercyclical variations in risk premia. The model posits a fundamentally novel description of risk premia: Investors fear stock primarily because they do poorly in recessions unrelated to the risks of long-run average consumption growth.

publicationCitation.value: Campbell, John Y.; Cochrane, John H., 1999, "By force of habit: a consumption-based explanation of aggregate stock market behavior," The Journal of Political Economy, Vol 107, pages 205-251: article available here

fields.value: Subject: STANDARD DEPOSIT TERMS 1.0  Type: DATAPASS:TERMS:STANDARD:1.0  Notes: This study was deposited under the of the Data-PASS standard deposit terms. A copy of the usage agreement is included in the file section of this study.;

files.description: This file contains aggregate nominal per capita consumption of nondurables and services and the corresponding consumption deflator, annually 1889-1992. The deflator is 1 in 1987, so it converts to 1987 dollars. The series are updated versions of the ones used in Grossman and Shiller (1981), Campbell and Shiller (RFS 1988), and elsewhere in the equity premium literature. ASCII raw numbers and program file
files.label: CONSUME.DAT
categories: 2d. Data - Aggregate Nominal Per Capita Consumption

files.description: This file contains annual data on Equity Markets for the US. It contains data on the S&P 500 Price Index and Dividends. This data is an updated version of that used in Grossman and Shiller (1981) and elsewhere in the equity premium literature. The updating is based on CRSP Indices Files on the S&P 500 Universe. ASCII raw numbers and program file
files.label: USAYE.DAT
categories: 2o. Data - Annual Data on Equity Markets - US

dataFile.description: This file contains annual data on Equity Markets for the US. It contains data on the S&P 500 Price Index and Dividends. files.description: This file contains annual data on several macroeconomic variables for the US. This data is extracted from the Ibbotson Stocks, Bonds, Bills and Inflation CRSP Indices Files and Citibase. The early part of the sample is taken from the USAYE file. ASCII raw numbers and program file
